page.title: 16Home Life The Allotment
page.content: Boundary Way is a road on the edge of Warstones estate. It is called Boundary Way because it is on the boundary between Wolverhampton and Staffordshire.On Boundary Way is Highfields School. Highfields is where most of the local children go when they are 11 years old. They usually leave when they are 16 but can stay on until they are 18. Farther down Boundayr Way are the allotments. My dad owns an allotment which he shares with the Callows. We go down to the allotment twice every week and if one family cannot come the other is always there. We grow goose- berries, strawberries,broad beans, peas tomatoes, cabbages, onions and marrows. When all the fruit and vegetables are grown we share them between the two families. The allotment is rented from the council.
